Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Pore-forming peptide ameobapore A (EH-APP; saposin-like protein)
Sequence Information.Target Organism: Gram-positive bacteria:Micrococcus luteus (MIC=1.9 µM), Bacillus megaterium (MIC=13 µM), Bacillus subtilis (MIC=27 µM), Staphylococcus aureus (MIC>15 µM).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: No cytotoxicity information found in the reference(s) presented
Sequence Information.Structure Description: Amoebapore A belongs to the superfamily of saposin-like proteins that are characterized by a conserved disulfide bond pattern and a fold consisting of five helices.(Ref.3)
Sequence Information.Comments: Forms pores in the cytoplasmic membrane of host cells. Implicated in the cytolytic activity of the parasite.

Literature.Title: Amoebapores, a family of membranolytic peptides from cytoplasmic granules of Entamoeba histolytica isolation, primary structure, and pore formation in bacterial cytoplasmic membranes.
